newsitem.title: USA: U.S. stocks seen firming at market open.
newsitem.headline: U.S. stocks seen firming at market open.

text.p: Wall Street stocks were expected to gain in mixed trade at the open on Thursday, helped by solid earnings reports and momentum from the Dow's surge past the 8,000-point milestone yesterday.
While shares might see some early profit-taking, the stock market would likely wend its way higher, provided second quarter earnings reports were good, analysts said.

"We will probably continue to drift a little higher," Charles White, managing director of Avatar Associates said. "So far, earnings reports have been okay to slightly better than forecast...the bond market has some follow-through too."
In early trade, the Standard & Poor's 500 futures index added 1.20 points to 943.50.
The long bond, which yesterday broke through resistance at a 6.5 percent yield, was up 4/32 at 6.47 percent.
The bond market firmed slightly after the release of jobless claims for the recent week, which fell to 347,000, near the forecast 345,000 level.
June housing starts data also came in close to expectations, rising to a 1.452 million unit annual rate.
The Dow Jones Industrial average closed up 63 points at 8039 yesterday. Nasdaq ended up 38.5 points at 1581.
